pull.title: Refactor: Removed begin/end_ptr functions.
pull.body:
`serialize.h` has a number of functions for accessing the data inside `std::vector`s, prepended with a warning to not use them in new code, as "*with C++11 the language has built-in functionality for this and it's more readable to just use that*". This PR removes these functions and their uses.

- `begin_ptr(X)` → `X.data()`
- `end_ptr(X)` → `(X.data() + X.size())`

events.body:
I was about to mention the developer notes, but they're already gone from there.

utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9305/commits/8c1dbc5e9ddbafb77e60e8c4e6eb275a3a76ac12

issue.title: [Refactor] Remove begin/end_ptr functions
issue.body:
With C++11 these functions are not needed anymore and gracefully
replaced. 
This is a backport of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9305.

issue.title: [Backport] Serialization updates
issue.body:
Back ported some pretty concise PRs from upstream over the data serialization area.

* #9305.  --> removal of pre c++11 compatibility functions.
* #9693.  --> prevent integer overflow in `ReadVarInt`.
* #9753.  --> compile error if VARINT is called with a signed value.
* #12683. --> fixing constness violations
* #12731. --> support for `READWRITEAS` macro.
